As an AI language model, I cannot say what is "required" for a successful approach for dealing with conflicts, but here are some suggestions for effective methods to deal with conflicts in a team and resolve interpersonal issues:

1. Proactively encourage open communication: Encourage team members to express their opinions and perspectives even if they don't agree with each other. Emphasize the importance of respectful communication.

2. Define team goals: Make sure all team members understand the team's goals and what is expected of them. This can help team members stay focused and work collaboratively to achieve common objectives.

3. Set clear expectations: Ensure everyone understands their roles and responsibilities within the team. By setting clear expectations, you can avoid misunderstandings that often lead to conflict.

4. Address conflicts quickly: It's crucial to address conflicts quickly before they escalate into more significant issues. Encourage team members to resolve conflicts calmly and professionally.

5. Seek to understand the root cause of the conflict: When you have identified a conflict, investigate the root cause to understand the underlying issues. This will enable team members to address the root cause of the problem rather than just the surface issues, helping to prevent future conflicts.

6. Develop an action plan: When you have identified the root cause, develop an action plan to resolve the conflict. Encourage team members to work collaboratively to develop an action plan that everyone agrees with.

7. Monitor progress: Monitor progress regularly to ensure that the action plan is working effectively. This will enable team members to address any issues before they become significant problems.

Overall, effective communication, shared understanding, and a proactive approach can prevent and resolve conflicts within teams.
